name: Conditional order entitlement granted (SOLE AND JOINT APPLICANTS)
body:
Case number: ((reference number))

Dear ((first name)) ((last name)),

Your application for a 'conditional order' has been accepted. The court agrees that you are entitled to ((isDivorce??get divorced))((isDissolution??end your civil partnership)).

You can read and download your 'certificate of entitlement' to a conditional order by signing into your HMCTS account. This is the document that says the court does not see any reason why you cannot ((isDivorce??get a divorce))((isDissolution??end your civil partnership)). 

Sign in: ((signin url))

#What happens next
A judge will 'pronounce' (read out) your conditional order at a hearing. The hearing will take place at ((court name)) on ((date of hearing)) at ((time of hearing)).  

You do not need to come to the hearing, unless you want to object to any of the orders which are being made. If you want to attend, you must tell the court by ((date of hearing minus seven days)). You can tell them by using the contact details below. 

After your conditional order has been pronounced, you will then be able to apply for a 'final order' on ((CO pronouncement date plus 43 days)). This is the final step in the ((isDivorce??divorce)) process and will legally end your ((isDivorce??marriage))((isDissolution??civil partnership)).  

Divorce and Dissolution 
HM Courts & Tribunals Service 
divorcecase@justice.gov.uk
0300 303 0642 (Monday to Friday, 8am to 6pm) 

Your feedback helps improve this service for others: https://www.smartsurvey.co.uk/s/Divorce_Feedback/?pageurl=/email.
subject: Your ((isDivorce??divorce))((isDissolution??application to end your civil partnership)): entitlement for conditional order has been granted
